alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Pittsylvania (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 6:20PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Pittsylvania and southeastern Franklin Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 620 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Western Smith Mountain Lake, or near Rocky Mount, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Penhook... Callands... Sago... Western Smith Mountain Lake... Union Hall... Sontag... and Southern Smith Mountain Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for north central North Carolina...and south central, central, southwestern and west central Virginia.
